title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Thursday 26 October 2017 - BBC News

more buildings 'at risk ' in the east midlands .
muslim leaders offer to talk with pork attackers .
man in court over pavement crash .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: our live coverage has ended for the day , but some news , sport and travel updates will continue to be posted on this page automatically overnight .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 tomorrow morning .

documents.title: new car park for nottingham
text: a new car park will be built in nottingham in time for christmas , the city council has confirmed .
the car park on the island site , off london road , will `` help with the loss of the broadmarsh and unity square car parks '' , the council said .
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: delay in carabao cup draw
text: wondering who leicester city will play in the quarter-final of the carabao cup ?
are n't we all ?
the draw was supposed to be made at 16:00 but there 's a delay .
if you 're interested the bbc has some hilariously entertaining coverage going on here .
update : twitter engineers continue to work on the problem .
the efl will be bringing you the draw as soon as is practically possible
what 's that series called ?
you could probably watch the first series while waiting for this draw .
fab idea , i 'll get started .
let me know when it starts if your still alive !
just give it red bull till the end of the season lads
would n't be a bad idea
brilliant idea
why not give it to coca cola ?
in the 90s it was known as the coca cola cup .
milk , give it back to milk
the milk cup ?

dayuuum .
i 'm sure they would 've done better than carabao
u mad ?
i 'm going to be a massive bristol city fan that night
shocking .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cocaine dealing gang jailed
text: six men from leicestershire have been jailed for a total of almost 39 years between them for their parts in a conspiracy to supply cocaine .
police have said they recovered about 2.5 kilos of high purity cocaine and £ 42,000 in cash during their investigation .
investigator victoria stather said the men were members of an organised crime group supplying class a drugs across the city .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'illegal rave ' to be disbanded
text: police have warned an illegal rave that may be taking place in north derbyshire this weekend will be disbanded .
a post on the police website says officers will be attending to stop the event in hollingwood and they 're urging people not to go .
they 're also asking parents to warn their children against attending .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : row of ticketed cars in nottingham
text: there will be a few glum faces this evening when these are discovered .
these ticketed cars were filmed this afternoon in the sheriff 's lodge car park in canal street , nottingham .
a nottingham city council spokesman said the cars were either not displaying a valid permit or not displaying a valid ticket .
staff from the biocity building have permits for this site which is also being used as an overflow car park while the broadmarsh car park is being demolished .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: taggart positive about puel appointment
text: a former leicester city player has said fans who doubt new manager claude puel must look back at his track record .
the response by fans to the frenchman 's appointment has been underwhelming but gerry taggart said his achievements in club football speak for themselves .
it speaks for itself - champions league semi-final , second or third place i think it was with nice and then obviously what he did with southampton .
look at southampton now .
i bet the majority of southampton fans would love to have claude puel back . ''
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: tigers players make england autumn international side
text: five leicester tigers players have been named in a 34-man squad for the autumn internationals .
jonny may , george ford , ben youngs , dan cole and ellis genge are the players named .
england face argentina on 11 november , before playing australia and samoa .
breaking | your england squad for the opening match of the # omwseries against argentina # carrythemhome
imagine jonny may over rokoduguni
baffles me .
not just about the finishing ( both are lethal ) but work off the ball , off the wing , staying alive with the ball .
may beats roko on that
roko does all of those !
it 's his defence that lets him down .
positioning to be precise .
but that can easily be worked offers what most do n't

and put the stats together too

documents.title: weather : temperature dropping
text: it 'll be cloudy this afternoon with a few patches of drizzle here and there .
it 's feeling cooler with highs of 13c ( 55f ) .
tonight there 'll continue to be a few drizzly spells overnight with quite cloudy conditions expected .
the cloud will start to clear in the early hours .
lows of 6c ( 43f ) in rural spots .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: jewellery stolen from house in long eaton
text: a rolex watch was among a number of jewellery items stolen from a house in long eaton .
the property on conway street was broken into on 3 october while the owner was out .
it 's thought the burglar got in through the kitchen window after coming down a side alley into the back garden .
other items taken were a thomas sabo bracelet , charms and rings .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: self-service wine bar opens in city
text: love wine and hate talking to people ?
nottingham 's first self-service wine bar , called another ?
wine bar , opens in trinity square tomorrow .
drinkers are given a tab card , which can be used to activate machines that offers reds , whites , roses , sparkling wines , prosecco and champagne .
at the end of the evening , they hand their tab in and pay their bill .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man jailed for attempted smuggling
text: a man from leicester has been jailed after he attempted to smuggle two men into the uk .
the home office has told the bbc jaswinder singh was sentenced to 18 months in prison after admitting a charge of assisting illegal entry .
the 54-year-old was stopped by border force officers at the uk control zone in france .
he presented his own british passport and two british passports for his passengers .
not convinced the passengers were british they were interviewed and revealed they were indian and had no right to enter the uk .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: armed police arrest man with 'bladed weapon '
text: armed police were deployed to the knighton area of leicester this afternoon following reports of a man with a `` bladed weapon '' .
a 28-year-old man was arrested on sus of affray and has been remanded into police custody .
it 's not thought that anyone was injured .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: replacement christmas presents donated to railway
text: a spokesman for the great central railway has been telling the bbc he ca n't understand why their christmas presents for poorly children have been stolen .
more than 370 of the wrapped gifts were taken from a cart at quorn and woodhouse station .
michael stokes said : `` it 's very upsetting .
i 'm not quite sure why people would want to hit children in that way .
`` the wonderful thing is , although we 've just reported it this morning , we 've already had people offering us presents to replace them which is absolutely fantastic .
`` one way or another i 'm sure we 'll be able to help the children out . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east midlands police dog kyle dies after illness
text: an east midlands police dog has died following a lengthy battle with a serious illness .
four-year-old kyle had been recovering at home following emergency surgery last month to remove his twisted colon .
handler pc paul burns said kyle spent his last hours with him at home with his wife and their three children .
`` he was the most beautiful , loving and hardworking dog , respected by all , '' he said .
it 's not fair that such a natural police dog just coming into his prime with years more service to come has suffered this bad luck . ''
heart-breaking news : police dog kyle passed away at home last night .
our thoughts are with his family .
more info :
oh sweet kyle , i 'm devastated by this .
thankyou for all your loyal service protecting us all & thoughts with your handler & family .
ditto .
i 've never even met him and hearing this had me in tears .
taken far too young .
bless him .
he really did give it a good fight .
he was a super dog , so kind and yet great at his job .
thank you for sharing our tears , it means the world to us x
i so love all our service dogs and genuinely feel a portion of the loss the families feel .
these dogs are so fantastic .
so sad to read this .
rip kyle you will always be a super paws hero !
thoughts to your handler and family at this sad time .

so sorry - it 's a hard emotional trauma to go through my prayers go out to you and your family for his passing < sniffles >
rip kyle i 've still got the jacket with the torn sleeve which i will now keep , my thoughts are with paul zoe and family .
and i 've still got the memories of you telling that story at briefing in fits of laughter .
# topdog

amen .

so sorry for your loss , condolences to his family .

sending big hugs , i 'm sure there was a big juicy bone waiting over rainbow bridge for him .

my prayers are with k9 kyle 's family .
rest in peace .

rip kyle thank you for your service x
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bare shelves at scene of charity christmas gifts theft
text: these are empty shelves at the great central railway in quorn , which had been full of christmas presents for sick children across leicestershire .
the 370 gifts were all wrapped ready to be given to the children 's ward at the leicester royal infirmary and rainbows children 's hos
but they were all stolen at some point in the last fortnight .
leicestershire police said they are investigating the theft .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: derbyshire flasher reports 'could be linked '
text: police believe three cases of sexual exposure on consecutive nights in south derbyshire might be linked to another incident earlier this month .
on 15 october at about 03:00 a 34-year-old woman was driving along deepdale lane in barrow upon trent when she saw a man standing on a canal bridge exposing himself .
on the next two nights the same woman reported seeing a man walk towards her vehicle while touching himself .
police said the exposures have similarities to an incident in etwall on 7 october when two women riding horses reported seeing a man touching himself in a field next to the path .
the man was described as chubby , in his 50s with short light coloured , greying hair .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: money stolen from woman 's purse in derby
text: police are appealing for help to identify this woman after a burglary on madeley street in derby .
a 66-year-old woman was followed into her flat by another woman who asked her for change for a note .
she then took money from the victim 's purse before leaving the flat .
the same woman then tried to go back inside the property again a few days later .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: crash death man named
text: a man who died after a crash in kirkby-in-ashfield , nottinghamshire , has been formally identified .
scott wilcox , from huthwaite , was one of two men on a motorbike that collided with a van in diamond avenue on tuesday .
the 27-year-old died at king 's mill hospital shortly afterwards .
the other man on the bike , a 22-year-old , remains in a critical condition .
a 46-year-old man has been arrested and released under investigation pending further enquiries .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: young players need time - warburton
text: young players need time - warburton

documents.title: boss rowett expects more from derby
text: boss rowett expects more from derby

documents.title: miniature housework at calke abbey
text: some major housework is under way at calke abbey .
they 've started their big winter clean that includes three days of vacuuming and dusting their dolls ' houses .
all of the rooms and their 210 contents will be cleaned including tiny china ornaments , dolls , beds and clocks .
phew - i thought normal housework was bad .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: knife used in attempted robbery
text: this is the knife used by a teenage boy attempting to rob a jogger in etwall earlier this year .
the 38-year-old woman was on the bridleway that runs alongside the a516 when she was approached by the boy .
he held up the knife and demanded her phone - when she refused to give it to him , he threw the knife into bushes .
police hope that by releasing a photo of the knife they can find out where it came from and who the teenager was .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: letter 'proves mayflower pilgrim was from scrooby '
text: new research has confirmed one of the original mayflower pilgrims was from nottinghamshire , a local historian has said .
sue allan said a letter written by susanna white-winslow 's second husband in 1623 confirms her father was richard jackson , the leaseholder of scrooby manor in north nottinghamshire .
before now the origin of susanna has been a mystery .

this is really exciting - susanna was a very important figure ; not only was she aboard the mayflower ship , she was also pregnant during the voyage and gave birth to the first child to be born once the mayflower reached the new world . ''
the mayflower was an english ship that famously transported the first english separatists from plymouth , uk to the `` new world '' .
just over 100 passengers made the journey across the atlantic to establish a new church .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: afternoon weather update
text: mainly dry but also mainly cloudy throughout this afternoon with just some occasional drizzle possible at times .
highs of 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: watch : couple marry 40 years after meeting
text: a couple from loughborough , kept apart by the woman 's strict father , have married almost 40 years later .
author: Caroline Lowbridge
BBC News Online

documents.title: your comments : stolen christmas gifts
text: it comes as no surprise that the stolen christmas presents from the great central railway in quorn have got you talking on facebook .
geraldine hunt said : `` just how sick must they be to steal from poorly children , hope karma will get them quick . ''
graeme wells said : `` nothing to do with the criminals being sick - they do n't care who the stuff is for .
probably does n't even enter there heads they just see money . ''
claire wood said : `` i 'm sure there will be at least 370 people who could put one extra gift in their basket to replace the presents and help sick children .
count me in for one . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: driver escapes police car crash
text: a driver says he feels lucky to `` still be here '' after a crash with a police car in derbyshire resulted in both cars being set on fire .
robson green told the bbc he was in a queue of traffic on the a515 between cubley and ashbourne when the police car crashed into the back of him .
he said he had to kick his door open to escape , while his passenger climbed out of the window .
this is how the cars ended up looking .
derbyshire constabulary said they could not comment on specifics while they investigated the crash .
author: Greig Watson
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: christmas presents for ill children stolen
text: hundreds of christmas presents , meant for poorly children in leicestershire , have been stolen .
at some point over the last two weeks 370 gifts were taken from a carriage at the great central railway in quorn .
they were supposed to be donated to the leicester royal infirmary children 's ward and rainbows children 's hos
the gifts were all donations that had been wrapped and were ready for delivery .
the police are investigating the incident and have asked anyone with any information to get in touch .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: council plans for assembly rooms to continue
text: the future of the assembly rooms in derby was up for discussion last night .
conservatives and lib dem councillors wanted the labour administration to revisit their plans to turn it into a live music and comedy venue costing £ 32m .
one of the main gripes was over the lack of public consultation .
deputy leader of the city council , martin rawson , admitted they could have done better at asking members of the public and the arts community what they wanted to see done with the assembly rooms .
he stressed everyone would get a chance to have their say at some stage .
plans can continue though .
a vote in front of the executive scrutiny committee finished seven votes to six in favour of the council 's cabinet .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man charged over 2014 fatal crash
text: man charged over 2014 fatal crash

documents.title: more buildings 'at risk ' in the east midlands
text: the east midlands has the highest proportion of buildings on the heritage at risk register than in any other english region .
historic england 's latest annual list has been published today and included 458 places across the east midlands .
in our region , 20 sites have been removed from the list while 41 places have been added .
derby city centre 's conservation area is no longer `` at risk '' thanks to eight years of investment in cathedral quarter shops .
however kibworth harcourt mill is among buildings now considered `` at risk '' .
the mill dates back to 1711 and there are now concerns about the strength of parts of the timber structure .
the east midlands has the highest proportion of highly graded buildings on the heritage at risk register of any region .
this means we will need to continue to make good use of our own grant aid , working in partnership with others in finding solutions .
there are some hard nuts to crack remaining on the register , but this year 's success stories demonstrate the wholly positive impact regenerated heritage has for us all . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: driver 's 'lucky ' police crash escape
text: driver 's 'lucky ' police crash escape

documents.title: muslim leaders 'happy ' to talk to mosque pork attack pair
text: two men who have been sentenced for smearing pork on the door of a mosque have been offered the chance to meet faith leaders to learn more about islam .
two men admitted religiously aggravated offences on wednesday after the attack at the al-quba masjid mosque , in nottingham , earlier this year .
dr saeed mughal , who is the mosque committee chairman , said : `` they [ the attackers ] do not understand how muslim people are .
`` we , as a community , are happy to meet them and if they need any advice or guidance we are more than happy to offer it . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather
text: watch : east midlands weather
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

local man gary lineker tweeted this when the news broke .
however he reacted a similar way to the appointment of claudio ranieri in 2015 - we all know how that turned out .
former premier league footballer leon osman questioned the ambitions of leicester city .

documents.title: hospital helipad fundraisers offered their cash back
text: donors who have helped raise millions for a hospital helipad are being offered their money back , after the project was postponed .
the original helipad ( which was due to open at nottingham 's queen 's medical centre in 2018 , will not appear for at least five years due to a change of plan .
now nottinghamshire university hospitals nhs trust wants the helipad to form part of a new emergency department .
`` we were very mindful that fundraisers had gone to enormous lengths to raise money in all sorts of imaginative ways , '' the trust 's chief executive peter homa said .
had the original helipad plan gone ahead , it would have cost £ 3.2m , funded by a £ 2.5m donation from the nottingham hospitals charity and a £ 700,000 investment from the hospital trust .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foxes 'underwhelming ' new manager
text: leicester city 's appointment of claude puel is not the arrival many expected when craig shakespeare was sacked - and will be regarded as an underwhelming appointment by many supporters .
frenchman puel was dismissed by southampton at the end of last season after a campaign that looked good on paper but left many of the fans at st mary 's cold with his style of play .
the problem for puel was his understated personality that did not create any bond with southampton 's supporters and tactics that became increasingly stodgy as the season progressed .
the frenchman was not among anyone 's considerations when shakespeare left , but leicester 's board has looked at his highly respectable record at monaco , lille , lyon and nice .
he will still , however , have to make a fast start as many will still regard him as damaged goods after his sacking by southampton and a departure that was not mourned .
author: Phil McNulty
BBC Sport chief football writer

documents.title: leicester city appoint ex-southampton manager
text: leicester city have appointed ex-southampton boss claude puel as their new manager on a three-year deal .
puel becomes the foxes ' third manager this year , replacing craig shakespeare who succeeded premier league title winner claudio ranieri in february .
puel , 56 , led the saints to eighth in his first season in charge , as well as reaching the efl cup final , but the frenchman was sacked in june .
michael appleton will remain as leicester 's assistant manager .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: latest from the region 's roads
text: here 's how it is looking on the region 's roads :
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man in court over pavement crash
text: a 22-year-old man is due in court charged with attempted murder following a crash in ripley on saturday .
jake greenhalgh , from downmeadow in heage , will appear at chesterfield justice centre charged with attempted murder .
it 's after a 27-year-old man was hit by a car as he walked along the pavement .
he remains in hospital in a critical but stable condition .
four other people arrested in connection with the crash have been released under investigation .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good morning : welcome to today 's live updates
text: good morning and welcome along to thursday 's east midlands live .
dave wade , amy woodfield and i are here until later and will be bringing you the best of the region 's news , sport , weather and travel .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live
